summary: BnHA Chapter 188: Hard Knocks Path to Redemption
title: BnHA Chapter 188: Hard Knocks Path to Redemption
body:
Previously on BnHA: The Todoroki kids sans Shouto (and Dabi lulz) visited their mom at the hospital and awkwardly discussed Endeavor officially becoming the #1 hero. Shouto’s older brother Natsuo wasn’t happy about it, saying that the world doesn’t know about “what he did” and how he treated his family. But interestingly, Rei came to his defense, saying that things were more complex than that. She said she doesn’t know what’s going on in his heart, “but he hasn’t left us behind.” We then cut to Endeavor’s fight with the High Tide Noumu, which basically consisted of Endeavor hovering for a few seconds with his flames, and then getting very violently flung through a building. Like, he was basically used as a human laser saw to cut the top of this high rise clean off. A bunch of people nearly fell to their deaths, but thankfully Hawks saved them all with his ridiculously OP Mighty Wings quirk. Speaking of Hawks, idk but it sure is some shifty bullshit that Your Highness Noumu just happened to attack him and Endeavor in this building right when they were having a chitchat about Noumus. Something is definitely up you guys.

Today on BnHA: Endeavor continues to battle the High Heaven Noumu and pulls off some impressive feats, such as dicing a falling building into tiny pieces with his flames so that the spectators below don’t get crushed. Unfortunately these techniques come at a price, and he finds himself beginning to struggle due to the heat building up in his body. Meanwhile the High Hopes Noumu remains mostly unfazed, even dispatching a bunch of disgusting slimy clone things to wreak some havoc and distract Hawks and the other pros on the scene so that they can’t assist. Realizing he has no choice but to Go For It, Endeavor powers up his flames and hits the Noumu with massive flame attack: Prominence Burn. Unfortunately the Noumu anticipates his actions and is able to avoid being completely disintegrated. He regenerates, and then brutally slashes/stabs Endeavor in the most ironic spots possible – his torso (nearly the same place where All Might was wounded by AFO), and his left eye (don’t think I have to explain this one lol). It’s all very violent, and probably not the sort of thing you’d want your child to witness on live television – oh hey there Shouto. Didn’t see you there. Uh… well, shit.


(As always, all comments not marked with an ETA are my unspoiled reactions from my first readthrough of this chapter. I’ve read up through chapter 209 now, so any ETAs will reflect that.)


  • interesting title!



  • I wonder which of his four kids this is referring to? ngl I’ve been missing the U.A. kids for these past couple chapters so it would be nice to get Shouto back in here
  • holy shittttt



  • thiiiiiiiis is bad. that is some serious destruction. not something they can just shrug their shoulders about later, especially in BnHA where damage like this actually has lasting consequences
  • lol some other heroes are watching from a distance and they’re all “did Endeavor just Vidalia Chop Wizard that whole fucking building”
  • meanwhile Hawks is tumbling to safety on a nearby rooftop



  • and he’s referring here to Endeavor’s opening line in the chapter, “I’ll dice you up and burn you until there’s nothing left”
  • (ETA: in addition to being the first reluctant hero in the series, Hawks is also the quippiest we’ve had by far. Hawks is all your dialogue polished up by a Marvel screenwriting team or what)



  • I appreciate Hawks’s efforts at combat banter, but all I keep thinking is that those pieces actually did look remarkably neat and uniform, and that it wouldn’t kill him to show a little appreciation for what was honest to god one of the most insane quirk feats we’ve seen to date
  • also, looking at this picture more closely, my disbelief is gonna need a little more suspending, because I honestly don’t feel like either of them should currently be able to fly the way they’re doing lol. Hawks’s wings are in a pretty sorry state at the moment
  • and here comes High Treason Noumu back at them again, and he’s grumbling “bird…” like he’s all pissy at Hawks
  • lol what is this



  • what the hell is this quirk. does he shoot air gun fists or something. and this other guy has all of his fingers fucking disconnected for no apparent reason. like, what the hell is that even gonna do besides gross people out
  • (ETA: and isn’t this Tokage’s quirk as well. getting lazy are we Horikoshi)
  • now High Score Noumu is doing something disturbing oh god



  • ffffffffff WHAT IS THIS. WHY DO WE HAVE TO LOOK AT A CLOSE UP OF IT
  • Endeavor’s hitting it with another fire blast. thanks man
  • and now he’s doing a mental tally of the thing’s quirks



  • and don’t forget “can fucking talk.” not to mention what I still think is the most intriguing one of all, “has Kurogiri’s fucking face”
  • oh and I guess this is a new one



  • fucking gross ew fuck sick gross ugh!! why are they so gooey sob
  • I don’t really understand what’s going on but Endeavor seems to have it all figured out, so here



  • okay so he wants to fight strong opponents like Endeavor so he made some disgusting clones to deal with the small fries I guess
  • – hold up. that muscle amplification quirk… that looks and sounds a whole lot like Muscular’s, though
  • is it just coincidence? that this Noumu just so happens to be so strikingly similar to not one but two captured villains previously associated with the League?? just what in the hell is going on here dammit
  • meanwhile, as Endeavor observed, the Noumus that emerged from his body look completely different and appear to be just your everyday run-of-the-mill Noumus



  • just a little grosser is all
  • Hawks is swooping down and taking them out without much effort. looks like he’s gotten most of his feathers back too
  • he’s telling everyone to keep evacuating
  • and he says that to be frank, power struggles aren’t his “forte”



  • so he’s acknowledging that he doesn’t have the All Might Factor, so to speak? that even though he’s strong and popular, he’s not at that level of always beating the big bads no matter what?
  • you know, that actually makes some sense. I can maybe understand a little better just why he was bothering Endeavor so much. that is, if it weren’t for the fact that I STILL DON’T TRUST YOU, HAWKS, YOU SUSPICIOUS LITTLE SERAPH
  • High Speed Noumu is asking Endeavor if he’s done shooting those red hot little slice-and-dice death rays
  • oh snap this thing really is smart



  • it’s not just talking and thinking, it’s fucking analyzing. there’s some real brainpower at work in this thing
  • now Endeavor is talking about his quirk, and I’m just gonna post the panel because like hell am I gonna try to summarize this



  • he was thinking this a few panels earlier, too. that he’s got a lot of heat built up now
  • and now he’s thinking about Rei and his kids with their ice powers



  • fuck me but every single time I start wanting to root for Endeavor he’s gotta go and remind us of this, though
  • also!? fourth kid alert!?? and this kid seems to have white hair just like all the others, and seems to be younger than Natsuo in this shot. which would seem to go against the prevailing theory? explain yourself, manga
  • (ETA: lol and I got an ask about this just today. I gotta give this some thought. but I still think it’s Dabi! maybe Endeavor is just confused about what his non-Shouto children looks like because he spent so much time ignoring them all!)
  • so now Highlander Noumu is making a crazy face and extending his arms or muscle fibers or whatever the fuck these things are again, and saying he wants to test out his new power on Endeavor
  • shiiiiiit this does not look good



  • this doesn’t seem like the kind of move he can maintain for very long given what he was saying earlier
  • he’s shouting at the Noumu that he’ll incinerate him until there’s nothing left, and his regeneration won’t be enough
  • well this has worked before, to be fair. back in Hosu
  • but why do I get the feeling that isn’t going to be the case this time, though
  • lollllll



  • is this the literal translation. is there some other meaning of “prominence” other than “famous and well-known” that I’m not thinking of. I guess it can also mean “something that sticks out a lot”, but I don’t see how that would apply to this attack
  • basically, to me this reads as “Endeavor’s I-Wanna-Be-Famous Big Fire Attack”
  • and damned if that just doesn’t say it all, though
  • he’s thinking back to what he said at the JP Hero Billboard thing. “just watch me”
  • and that he won’t disgrace himself by failing here
  • ohhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh shit



  • HE WAS SO CLOSE



  • THIS THING IS REALLY FUCKING HARDCORE OMG
  • OH MY GOD



  • you’re telling me that Endeavor’s attack actually worked, but that he wasn’t able to disintegrate the whole Noumu because HE FUCKING RIPPED HIS OWN FUCKING HEAD OFF AND FRISBEE-D IT TO SAFETY AHEAD OF TIME!?
  • OH SHIT



  • goddamn – fucking –
  • DAMMIT. COME ON ENDEAVOR. DON’T FUCKING DIE, DUDE. FUCKING GET YOUR SHIT TOGETHER AND BEAT THIS HIGH FIVE NOUMU ALREADY, THE WORLD NEEDS YOU
  • ARE YOU SERIOUS



  • ARE YOU TELLING ME THE TWO OF THEM JUST HAPPENED TO BE WATCHING?? ARE YOU FUCKING SERIOUS, SHIT
  • YOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO



  • motherfucker oh shit you guysssss
  • (ETA: how does he even still have that eye though)
  • you guys. oh shit. this is so bad. you don’t understand
  • shit. because let me tell you, the very first thing that ran through my head was that he’s going to look so much hotter now and fuck, you guys. I KNOW THAT’S NOT WHAT I’M SUPPOSED TO BE THINKING RIGHT NOW. BUT I CAN’T HELP IT. noooo what the hell is wrong with me I feel like slapping myself lmao
  • I fucking started laughing in real life at my own absurd reaction. I am ruining the mood of this chapter so damn fast
  • nooooooo



  • the parallels, though. oh shit. the same eye
  • and did Shouto’s quirk activate just now?? are those flames on his left side? oh shit
  • okay I need to get myself under control. fucking stop this now. stop thinking about how much hotter Endeavor is going to be with a big ol’ slashy scar along the left side of his face. and maybe an eyepatch. oh god. no, stop
  • (ETA: I really thought there was going to be an eyepatch. how does he still have that eye)
  • and now we’re cutting back to U.A. and Aizawa is gently telling Eri he’s gonna take her back to his room and I can’t you guys. first Endeavor losing his fucking eye and now Aizawa being a loving, protective parent on two counts, because LOOK WHAT HE SAYS RIGHT AFTER



  • now All Might is gripping at his stomach wound nooooo



  • seems like every big hero has That Moment, huh
  • oh fuckkkkk



  • fuuuuuck, Endeavor. going for that hard knocks path to redemption, huh
  • but I fucking can’t, though, because I just keep picturing Horikoshi’s creative process. like, you fucking troll, though. goes and creates the worst character of all time (not literally, I’m just being dramatic here just let me have this) and does his absolute fucking best to make him as terrible as possible, and then challenges himself to redeem him nonetheless. “how can I make readers actually feel sympathy for Todoroki fucking Enji in spite of everything? oh I know I’ll take away everything he ever wanted and make him finally start to realize what was really important and have him finally start trying to be a better husband and father. and then I’ll fucking murder him”
  • and like, I really need to stop laughing at this chapter, though. I’m ruining it, I know. if it helps, it’s not mirthful laughter though! the best way I can describe it is “haunted house laughter.” like, this is how I react when I’m walking through any sort of haunted attraction, and I’m really tense and excited and on edge. my weird natural response is usually to start laughing, possibly as my brain’s way of psyching myself up to be brave and reminding myself that it’s not real and they’re only actors. I feel like that, for some reason. and I don’t know why, but it’s actually a very positive thing, because this is the first time in quite a while that I’ve gotten this excited about the manga, actually
  • so I’m sorry, Endeavor. I’m not laughing at you, I’m laughing because OH SHIT THIS IS GETTING GOOD and I’m really loving it. and also because Horikoshi has got some serious balls
  • (ETA: and because this is Kamino all over again. and I was fucking pumped. angst!! stakes!! tension!! there was just a ton of adrenaline all of a sudden and I didn’t really know what to do with it so my brain was like “well then let’s just do something really weird!”)
  • anyway, so we’re cutting back to Shouto and U.A., where Shouto is watching his dad die on live television



  • aaaaaand that’s the chapter end
  • my god. this went from “eh” to “epic” in like .06 seconds. is this the fight that anon was talking about a while back? because this was pretty damn good, I gotta say. fucking damn
body_abstract:
Previously on BnHA: The Todoroki kids sans Shouto (and Dabi lulz) visited their mom at the hospital and awkwardly discussed Endeavor officially becoming the #1 hero. Shouto’s older brother Natsuo wasn’t happy about it, saying that the world doesn’t know about “what he did” and how he treated his family. But interestingly, Rei came to his defense, saying that things were more complex than that. She said she doesn’t know what’s going on in his heart, “but he hasn’t left us behind.” We then cut to Endeavor’s fight with the High Tide Noumu, which basically consisted of Endeavor hovering for a few seconds with his flames, and then getting very violently flung through a building. Like, he was basically used as a human laser saw to cut the top of this high rise clean off. A bunch of people nearly fell to their deaths, but thankfully Hawks saved them all with his ridiculously OP Mighty Wings quirk. Speaking of Hawks, idk but it sure is some shifty bullshit that Your Highness Noumu just happened to attack him and Endeavor in this building right when they were having a chitchat about Noumus. Something is definitely up you guys.

Today on BnHA: Endeavor continues to battle the High Heaven Noumu and pulls off some impressive feats, such as dicing a falling building into tiny pieces with his flames so that the spectators below don’t get crushed. Unfortunately these techniques come at a price, and he finds himself beginning to struggle due to the heat building up in his body. Meanwhile the High Hopes Noumu remains mostly unfazed, even dispatching a bunch of disgusting slimy clone things to wreak some havoc and distract Hawks and the other pros on the scene so that they can’t assist. Realizing he has no choice but to Go For It, Endeavor powers up his flames and hits the Noumu with massive flame attack: Prominence Burn. Unfortunately the Noumu anticipates his actions and is able to avoid being completely disintegrated. He regenerates, and then brutally slashes/stabs Endeavor in the most ironic spots possible – his torso (nearly the same place where All Might was wounded by AFO), and his left eye (don’t think I have to explain this one lol). It’s all very violent, and probably not the sort of thing you’d want your child to witness on live television – oh hey there Shouto. Didn’t see you there. Uh… well, shit.


(As always, all comments not marked with an ETA are my unspoiled reactions from my first readthrough of this chapter. I’ve read up through chapter 209 now, so any ETAs will reflect that.)

  • so I’m sorry, Endeavor. I’m not laughing at you, I’m laughing because OH SHIT THIS IS GETTING GOOD and I’m really loving it. and also because Horikoshi has got some serious balls
  • (ETA: and because this is Kamino all over again. and I was fucking pumped. angst!! stakes!! tension!! there was just a ton of adrenaline all of a sudden and I didn’t really know what to do with it so my brain was like “well then let’s just do something really weird!”)
  • anyway, so we’re cutting back to Shouto and U.A., where Shouto is watching his dad die on live television



  • aaaaaand that’s the chapter end
  • my god. this went from “eh” to “epic” in like .06 seconds. is this the fight that anon was talking about a while back? because this was pretty damn good, I gotta say. fucking damn
trail.content:
Previously on BnHA: The Todoroki kids sans Shouto (and Dabi lulz) visited their mom at the hospital and awkwardly discussed Endeavor officially becoming the #1 hero. Shouto’s older brother Natsuo wasn’t happy about it, saying that the world doesn’t know about “what he did” and how he treated his family. But interestingly, Rei came to his defense, saying that things were more complex than that. She said she doesn’t know what’s going on in his heart, “but he hasn’t left us behind.” We then cut to Endeavor’s fight with the High Tide Noumu, which basically consisted of Endeavor hovering for a few seconds with his flames, and then getting very violently flung through a building. Like, he was basically used as a human laser saw to cut the top of this high rise clean off. A bunch of people nearly fell to their deaths, but thankfully Hawks saved them all with his ridiculously OP Mighty Wings quirk. Speaking of Hawks, idk but it sure is some shifty bullshit that Your Highness Noumu just happened to attack him and Endeavor in this building right when they were having a chitchat about Noumus. Something is definitely up you guys.

Today on BnHA: Endeavor continues to battle the High Heaven Noumu and pulls off some impressive feats, such as dicing a falling building into tiny pieces with his flames so that the spectators below don’t get crushed. Unfortunately these techniques come at a price, and he finds himself beginning to struggle due to the heat building up in his body. Meanwhile the High Hopes Noumu remains mostly unfazed, even dispatching a bunch of disgusting slimy clone things to wreak some havoc and distract Hawks and the other pros on the scene so that they can’t assist. Realizing he has no choice but to Go For It, Endeavor powers up his flames and hits the Noumu with massive flame attack: Prominence Burn. Unfortunately the Noumu anticipates his actions and is able to avoid being completely disintegrated. He regenerates, and then brutally slashes/stabs Endeavor in the most ironic spots possible – his torso (nearly the same place where All Might was wounded by AFO), and his left eye (don’t think I have to explain this one lol). It’s all very violent, and probably not the sort of thing you’d want your child to witness on live television – oh hey there Shouto. Didn’t see you there. Uh… well, shit.


(As always, all comments not marked with an ETA are my unspoiled reactions from my first readthrough of this chapter. I’ve read up through chapter 209 now, so any ETAs will reflect that.)


  • interesting title!



  • I wonder which of his four kids this is referring to? ngl I’ve been missing the U.A. kids for these past couple chapters so it would be nice to get Shouto back in here
  • holy shittttt



  • thiiiiiiiis is bad. that is some serious destruction. not something they can just shrug their shoulders about later, especially in BnHA where damage like this actually has lasting consequences
  • lol some other heroes are watching from a distance and they’re all “did Endeavor just Vidalia Chop Wizard that whole fucking building”
  • meanwhile Hawks is tumbling to safety on a nearby rooftop



  • and he’s referring here to Endeavor’s opening line in the chapter, “I’ll dice you up and burn you until there’s nothing left”
  • (ETA: in addition to being the first reluctant hero in the series, Hawks is also the quippiest we’ve had by far. Hawks is all your dialogue polished up by a Marvel screenwriting team or what)



  • I appreciate Hawks’s efforts at combat banter, but all I keep thinking is that those pieces actually did look remarkably neat and uniform, and that it wouldn’t kill him to show a little appreciation for what was honest to god one of the most insane quirk feats we’ve seen to date
  • also, looking at this picture more closely, my disbelief is gonna need a little more suspending, because I honestly don’t feel like either of them should currently be able to fly the way they’re doing lol. Hawks’s wings are in a pretty sorry state at the moment
  • and here comes High Treason Noumu back at them again, and he’s grumbling “bird…” like he’s all pissy at Hawks
  • lol what is this



  • what the hell is this quirk. does he shoot air gun fists or something. and this other guy has all of his fingers fucking disconnected for no apparent reason. like, what the hell is that even gonna do besides gross people out
  • (ETA: and isn’t this Tokage’s quirk as well. getting lazy are we Horikoshi)
  • now High Score Noumu is doing something disturbing oh god



  • ffffffffff WHAT IS THIS. WHY DO WE HAVE TO LOOK AT A CLOSE UP OF IT
  • Endeavor’s hitting it with another fire blast. thanks man
  • and now he’s doing a mental tally of the thing’s quirks



  • and don’t forget “can fucking talk.” not to mention what I still think is the most intriguing one of all, “has Kurogiri’s fucking face”
  • oh and I guess this is a new one



  • fucking gross ew fuck sick gross ugh!! why are they so gooey sob
  • I don’t really understand what’s going on but Endeavor seems to have it all figured out, so here



  • okay so he wants to fight strong opponents like Endeavor so he made some disgusting clones to deal with the small fries I guess
  • – hold up. that muscle amplification quirk… that looks and sounds a whole lot like Muscular’s, though
  • is it just coincidence? that this Noumu just so happens to be so strikingly similar to not one but two captured villains previously associated with the League?? just what in the hell is going on here dammit
  • meanwhile, as Endeavor observed, the Noumus that emerged from his body look completely different and appear to be just your everyday run-of-the-mill Noumus



  • just a little grosser is all
  • Hawks is swooping down and taking them out without much effort. looks like he’s gotten most of his feathers back too
  • he’s telling everyone to keep evacuating
  • and he says that to be frank, power struggles aren’t his “forte”



  • so he’s acknowledging that he doesn’t have the All Might Factor, so to speak? that even though he’s strong and popular, he’s not at that level of always beating the big bads no matter what?
  • you know, that actually makes some sense. I can maybe understand a little better just why he was bothering Endeavor so much. that is, if it weren’t for the fact that I STILL DON’T TRUST YOU, HAWKS, YOU SUSPICIOUS LITTLE SERAPH
  • High Speed Noumu is asking Endeavor if he’s done shooting those red hot little slice-and-dice death rays
  • oh snap this thing really is smart



  • it’s not just talking and thinking, it’s fucking analyzing. there’s some real brainpower at work in this thing
  • now Endeavor is talking about his quirk, and I’m just gonna post the panel because like hell am I gonna try to summarize this



  • he was thinking this a few panels earlier, too. that he’s got a lot of heat built up now
  • and now he’s thinking about Rei and his kids with their ice powers



  • fuck me but every single time I start wanting to root for Endeavor he’s gotta go and remind us of this, though
  • also!? fourth kid alert!?? and this kid seems to have white hair just like all the others, and seems to be younger than Natsuo in this shot. which would seem to go against the prevailing theory? explain yourself, manga
  • (ETA: lol and I got an ask about this just today. I gotta give this some thought. but I still think it’s Dabi! maybe Endeavor is just confused about what his non-Shouto children looks like because he spent so much time ignoring them all!)
  • so now Highlander Noumu is making a crazy face and extending his arms or muscle fibers or whatever the fuck these things are again, and saying he wants to test out his new power on Endeavor
  • shiiiiiit this does not look good



  • this doesn’t seem like the kind of move he can maintain for very long given what he was saying earlier
  • he’s shouting at the Noumu that he’ll incinerate him until there’s nothing left, and his regeneration won’t be enough
  • well this has worked before, to be fair. back in Hosu
  • but why do I get the feeling that isn’t going to be the case this time, though
  • lollllll



  • is this the literal translation. is there some other meaning of “prominence” other than “famous and well-known” that I’m not thinking of. I guess it can also mean “something that sticks out a lot”, but I don’t see how that would apply to this attack
  • basically, to me this reads as “Endeavor’s I-Wanna-Be-Famous Big Fire Attack”
  • and damned if that just doesn’t say it all, though
  • he’s thinking back to what he said at the JP Hero Billboard thing. “just watch me”
  • and that he won’t disgrace himself by failing here
  • ohhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh shit



  • HE WAS SO CLOSE



  • THIS THING IS REALLY FUCKING HARDCORE OMG
  • OH MY GOD



  • you’re telling me that Endeavor’s attack actually worked, but that he wasn’t able to disintegrate the whole Noumu because HE FUCKING RIPPED HIS OWN FUCKING HEAD OFF AND FRISBEE-D IT TO SAFETY AHEAD OF TIME!?
  • OH SHIT



  • goddamn – fucking –
  • DAMMIT. COME ON ENDEAVOR. DON’T FUCKING DIE, DUDE. FUCKING GET YOUR SHIT TOGETHER AND BEAT THIS HIGH FIVE NOUMU ALREADY, THE WORLD NEEDS YOU
  • ARE YOU SERIOUS



  • ARE YOU TELLING ME THE TWO OF THEM JUST HAPPENED TO BE WATCHING?? ARE YOU FUCKING SERIOUS, SHIT
  • YOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO



  • motherfucker oh shit you guysssss
  • (ETA: how does he even still have that eye though)
  • you guys. oh shit. this is so bad. you don’t understand
  • shit. because let me tell you, the very first thing that ran through my head was that he’s going to look so much hotter now and fuck, you guys. I KNOW THAT’S NOT WHAT I’M SUPPOSED TO BE THINKING RIGHT NOW. BUT I CAN’T HELP IT. noooo what the hell is wrong with me I feel like slapping myself lmao
  • I fucking started laughing in real life at my own absurd reaction. I am ruining the mood of this chapter so damn fast
  • nooooooo



  • the parallels, though. oh shit. the same eye
  • and did Shouto’s quirk activate just now?? are those flames on his left side? oh shit
  • okay I need to get myself under control. fucking stop this now. stop thinking about how much hotter Endeavor is going to be with a big ol’ slashy scar along the left side of his face. and maybe an eyepatch. oh god. no, stop
  • (ETA: I really thought there was going to be an eyepatch. how does he still have that eye)
  • and now we’re cutting back to U.A. and Aizawa is gently telling Eri he’s gonna take her back to his room and I can’t you guys. first Endeavor losing his fucking eye and now Aizawa being a loving, protective parent on two counts, because LOOK WHAT HE SAYS RIGHT AFTER



  • now All Might is gripping at his stomach wound nooooo



  • seems like every big hero has That Moment, huh
  • oh fuckkkkk



  • fuuuuuck, Endeavor. going for that hard knocks path to redemption, huh
  • but I fucking can’t, though, because I just keep picturing Horikoshi’s creative process. like, you fucking troll, though. goes and creates the worst character of all time (not literally, I’m just being dramatic here just let me have this) and does his absolute fucking best to make him as terrible as possible, and then challenges himself to redeem him nonetheless. “how can I make readers actually feel sympathy for Todoroki fucking Enji in spite of everything? oh I know I’ll take away everything he ever wanted and make him finally start to realize what was really important and have him finally start trying to be a better husband and father. and then I’ll fucking murder him”
  • and like, I really need to stop laughing at this chapter, though. I’m ruining it, I know. if it helps, it’s not mirthful laughter though! the best way I can describe it is “haunted house laughter.” like, this is how I react when I’m walking through any sort of haunted attraction, and I’m really tense and excited and on edge. my weird natural response is usually to start laughing, possibly as my brain’s way of psyching myself up to be brave and reminding myself that it’s not real and they’re only actors. I feel like that, for some reason. and I don’t know why, but it’s actually a very positive thing, because this is the first time in quite a while that I’ve gotten this excited about the manga, actually
  • so I’m sorry, Endeavor. I’m not laughing at you, I’m laughing because OH SHIT THIS IS GETTING GOOD and I’m really loving it. and also because Horikoshi has got some serious balls
  • (ETA: and because this is Kamino all over again. and I was fucking pumped. angst!! stakes!! tension!! there was just a ton of adrenaline all of a sudden and I didn’t really know what to do with it so my brain was like “well then let’s just do something really weird!”)
  • anyway, so we’re cutting back to Shouto and U.A., where Shouto is watching his dad die on live television



  • aaaaaand that’s the chapter end
  • my god. this went from “eh” to “epic” in like .06 seconds. is this the fight that anon was talking about a while back? because this was pretty damn good, I gotta say. fucking damn

body:
Class 1-A’s Gay Squad Tier List.

Yuga, Shouto, Eijirou and Hitoshi made a list grading all the boys they know (even themselves), each one of the boys on the list is placed on a tier based on their overall charm and what type of boyfriend they would be (Some of the members are not happy with some of the placements but they had to be honest when making the list) . No one from outside the Gay Squad is allowed to see the fucking list.

Boy Tier list (from highest to lowest tier):

The “Would Die For You” Tier:

  • Izuku Midoriya
  • Eijirou Kirishima
  • Mirio Togata
  • Sero Hanta
  • Rikido Satou
  • Koji Koda

The “Treats You Right” Tier:

  • Fumikage Tokoyami
  • Juzo Honenuki
  • Mashirao Ojiro
  • Nirengeki Shoda
  • Sen Kaibara
  • Hiryu Rin
  • Yosetsu Awase
  • Shihai Kuroiro
  • Mezo Shoji
  • Manga Fukidashi
  • Kosei Tsuburaba
  • Yuga Aoyama
  • Tetsutetsu Tetsutestsu
  • Nagamasa Mora

The “Constant Cuddles” Tier:

  • Shouto Todoroki
  • Tenya Iida
  • Denki Kaminari
  • Hitoshi Shinsou
  • Jurota Shishida
  • Tamaki Amajiki
  • Togaru Kamakiri
  • Kojiro Bondo
  • Yo Shindo

The “Makes You Wanna DIE!” Tier:

  • Neito Monoma
  • Inasa Yoarashi

The “Literally FUCKING kills you!” Tier:

  • Seiji Shishikura
  • Katsuki Bakugou

The “NAH BITCH!” Tier:

  • Minoru Mineta

Notes:

  1. The Squad Members did not decide their own placements on the list, it was put up to vote
  2. Kiri tried really hard to convince the rest of the squad to not put his boyfriend in the “Literally FUCKING kills you!” Tier but his attempts were futile
  3. Shinsou is actually surprised that his boyfriend didn’t end up in the “NAH BITCH!” Tier
  4. The list was burned not long after it was made because in words of The 1-A’s Gay Squad “No-one can ever know”

summary:
Reference sheet for my BnHA OC Fuuro Kuroba Profile under the cut[[MORE]] 

Biographical Information Name: Kuroba Fuuro...
caption:
Reference sheet for my BnHA OC Fuuro Kuroba

Profile under the cut

Biographical Information

Name: Kuroba Fuuro
Nickname(s): Fuu, Birdbrain (by her brother)
Alias/Hero Name: The Nocturnal Heroine, Night Owl

Personal Description

Birthday: December 12
Star Sign: Sagittarius
Age: 17/18 years
Gender: female
Height: 181cm
Weight: 77kg
Hair colour: Dark grey
Eye colour: Purple
Skin colour: Tan
Quirk: Owl
Quirk type: Transformation
Quirk range: Short-range

Status

Status: Alive
Family:
  Kuroba Asuka (mother, alive)
   Kuroba Yuuto (father, alive)
   Kuroba Souma (younger brother, alive)
Affiliation: Yuuei Academy
Occupation: Student
Department: Heroics
Class: 2-A
Love Interest: Abe Shinju (OC)

Appearance
Fuuro is a tall, muscular girl with relatively broad shoulders. She has short black hair in an undercut and bright purple, upturned eyes. Her legs have a bird-like appearance with scaly skin, very sharp talons and an anisodactyl toe arrangement.
Her Yuuei uniform is sleeveless and it can open along the seams on the sides so it doesn’t rip when has to activate her Quirk while in uniform.

Personality

Ambitious | Prideful | Sporty | Hardworking | Competitive

Fuuro is extremely law-abiding and makes sure to follow rules set by authority at all times. If it isn’t about rules then she is fairly reasonable.
However she is not above pointless arguments and will often treat a discussion about trivial things too seriously. She tends to overlook any flaws of the people she idolizes greatly, like her mother and tends to be overly formal and reserved around them. Insulting those people greatly enrages her and if someone does so continually she will loose her temper. She won’t get violent usually but she can get very vocal when angry. She can see her own actions critically and also that of most other people (if she doesn’t happen to idolize them) so she is generally a good choice when you need an objective second opinion.
Fuuro very often tells herself that she prefers to work alone since her mother also works alone and she aspires to be like her but she always feels a certain comfort having someone by her side or watch her back. She can generally work well with others and is perfect for organizing teamwork as she has just the right authoritative presence to ensure that everyone is doing their part diligently.
She takes pride in her own abilites and accomplishments. Because she is a bit vain when it comes to that, it is very easy to get on her good side with flattery and compliments.
For people who don’t know her she often appears stoic and unapproachable with a stone-cold, serious expression and she tends to keep that image up around strangers because she wants to appear as someone admirable and authoritative. She only loosens up when around friends or her family. When she is comfortable and doesn’t feel the need to appear stern and control her expression, her emotions are very often painfully obvious in her face.
She finds it very easy to motivate herself. She enjoys challenging her own limits and regularily does so even if in a controlled manner. She sees stepping out of one’s boundaries as a way to improve and exceed yourself.
She is ready to face pressure and obstacles in her way to become a hero so she isn’t really that affected by pressure. She is determined to finish assigned tasks as quick as possible and works diligently and restlessly on them. She’s not a person that regularily slacks off.

Likes
-Punk fashion
-Sweets
-Storms
-Nighttime
-Meat (especially rabbit meat)
-Rainy nights
-The feeling of blowing wind

Dislikes
-Ghost stories
-Rule-breakers
-People who don’t want to leave their comfort zone
-Mornings
-The nicknames her brother gives her
-Insects

Quirk
Owl Wings

Fuuro’s Quirk allows her to transform her arms into owl wings with dark-grey/black feathers. When her Quirk is not active her arms have tiny black feathers protruding from the skin.

Advantage:

+ She can fly for a very long time

+ Her owl-like wings allow her to fly completely soundless which makes her a great suprise-attacker

+ Her arm muscles take a very long time to get tired

+She can easily defend herself against enemies with gas-based Quirks (can blow it away)

+She is also a good support for allies with a gas-based Quirk (can quickly blow it in the direction of the enemy)

Disadvantage:

- Carrying extra weight exhausts her quickly. She doesn’t mind one kilogramm or two. But everything over 5 kg drastically cuts her flying time. If she has to carry another person, she can maybe manage to fly for a couple of minutes before her wings give out.

- Her bones are lighter and thus more fragile, making her less suited for defense


Backstory:

Fuuro’s mother is a hero herself while her father, who is quirkless, works as a police officer.

Lawfullness practically ran in her family. She also has a younger brother.

Her mother Quirk lets her grow black-feathered wings on her back with which she can fly completely soundless and just like Fuuro has bird-like legs, though they are even more bird-like in structure than Fuuro’s. Additionally Asuka has feathery hair.

Fuuro’s Quirk manifested on a family trip while they were hiking. She climbed up a very high tree and was just enjoying the scenery when her Quirk manifested and she grew little feathers on her arms and her legs changed into the bird legs she has today. She noticed this and by chance transformed her arms into wings. She was absolutely thrilled, having looked up to her mother all her life and now she inherited her Quirk.

When her mother called out to her that they wanted to continue the hike, she flew down from the tree. Her mother was overjoyed, as was her father. At the end of the trip Fuuro’s hiking shoes were in shambles since her talons cut through them. She felt a bit bad about it, since they were kind of expensive. Afterwards her mother took her under her wing, quite literally.

Her younger brother remained quirkless and he eventually decided to pursue a career as a lawyer while Fuuro aimed to become a hero like her mother.

She brought herself in good physical shape by following a strict work-out schedule that her mother occasionally helped her with and studied very hard to get into Yuuei, where her mother had also studied. At Yuuei she entered the class 1-A (a year before the main cast enters the school, she is in 2-A during the story) and made friends amongst her classmates and even one outside the school. Two of them being Fukasu and Shinju. She eventually developed a crush on the latter. After being convinced by Fukasu she confessed to her and the two have been in a relationship ever since.



Relationships

Family

Kuroba Asuka - mother

Fuuro greatly idolized her mother. She looks up to her for risking her life on a daily basis for the greater good. She aspires to be like her mother and maybe take her place when she gets old. Fuuro tends to praise her to high heaven’s and doesn’t see any flaws that she might have.

Her mother is naturally very proud of what her daughter manages to achieve by following in her footsteps but silently wishes she’d try and be her own hero instead of imitating her.

Asuka spends a lot of time with her daughter but despite that their relationship is more like that of a teacher and student rather than mother and daughter which makes Asuka sad. Fuuro on the other hand doesn’t appear to be bothered by the formal and almost distant relationship she has with her mother.


Kuroba Yuuto - father

Fuuro looks up to her father as well but not to the extreme degree she does with her mother, ultimately making her relationship with him more “family-like”.

Yuuto is aware that Asuka is not happy about her current relationship with Fuuro and tries his best to convince his daughter to treat her mother more like a mother and communicate between the two without telling Fuuro explicitly how her mother feels because he knows Fuuro will think she has disappointed her mother in some way, which would only make the whole ordeal worse.


Kuroba Souma - younger brother

Souma doesn’t hold any grudges against his sister for inheriting their mother’s Quirk even though he turned out to be quirkless.

The two often bicker but mostly about trivial things and they don’t get too insulting, usually.

Souma has always made an effort to get better grades than Fuuro to show her that even if she has a Quirk and is more physically fit, he is the smarter one. His favourite nickname for Fuuro is “birdbrain” but he makes sure not to use it when their mother is around since she doesn’t like it when he calls her that. Even though he aspires to be a lawyer he doesn’t mind when he unintentionally (or intentionally) commits a minor misdemeanor. His nonchalant attitude about this and Fuuro’s overbearing law-abidingness are very often the cause of their bickering.


OCs

Hokori Fukasu - friend

They often hang out at Shinju’s place together, but not so much with just the two of them.

If it weren’t for Shinju the two of them probably would have never met. Fukasu finds Fuuro entertaining and often makes stupid dares with her (nothing that would break any rules though). Fukasu’s carefree attitude reminds Fuuro of her brother, which can be a good and a bad thing. She and Fuuro share a love for sweets

Fuuro got to know her when doing organisational work with Shinju at her place as Fukasu and her mother live there as well. Fukasu immidiately noticed that Shinju and Fuuro had a thing for each other. Fuuro is very thankful that she convinced her to confess to Shinju. Fukasu now is the designated “third wheel” whenever they hang out, but she doesn’t mind it.


Abe Shinju - girlfriend

They have been together since the end of their first year.
The two first started talking to each other when Shinju became the class president and Fuuro the vice class president. Fuuro also befriended a childhood friend of Shinju: Fukasu who attended Shiketsu High and whom she met at times when meeting at Shinju’s place.
The two started spending even more time with each other and got to know each other better. Having to organize class events together both of them learned how to rely on each other.
Shinju quickly finds herself enarmoured with Fuuro and her ambitious and motivational nature. Fuuro on the other hand falls for her over time, becoming smitten with Shinju’s elegance and the way she carries herself as well as her caring and gentle nature.
Fukasu has noticed the two developed feelings for each other and, after watching Fuuro make hearteyes at Shinju day after day, she eventually convinced Fuuro to make a move and the two got together.
Fuuro loves Shinju’s smile, her eyes. She often strokes her scales absent-mindedly when they cuddle. Shinju loves being carried around and held by Fuuro. It makes her feel safe and secure. She’d love Fuuro to fly around with her but knows that her girlfriend has limits in her strength so that is only a dream (for now).
With Fuuro Shinju feels comfortable enough to talk about personal things, such as her father. Fuuro knows when to let Shinju have her alone time, just as Shinju knows that Fuuro needs her time for her frequent training. Both know they can rely on and trust the other.
Shinju may see the value in simple things but she occasionally buys Fuuro expensive gifts, just to impress her girlfriend a little.
Since both have an interest for fashion (albeit different styles) they like going shopping together. Fuuro sometimes takes Shinju out to eat at small, local restaurants which Shinju is fascinated by, only being used to either eating at home or going to expensive restaurants.
At the end of a day the two also enjoy taking long walks on the beach together, Fuuro watching lovingly as Shinju excitedly collects various seashells.

Trivia

  • Fuuro is bisexual
  • She often trains her Quirk by strapping increasingly heavier weights to herself and flying around for as long as she can
  • Her love for punk fashion and intimidating appearance often give her the image of a delinquent when in reality she is a very law-abiding person and chastises even the smallest offense to the law
  • In her childhood a lot of socks and shoes ended up ripped and cut due to her very sharp talons so she stopped wearing them all together
  • She attacks like an owl, with her feet first
  • She has a habit of perching on high places
  • She is not a morning person
  • She tends to screw up her sleeping schedule by staying up too late

The two started spending even more time with each other and got to know each other better. Having to organize class events together both of them learned how to rely on each other.
Shinju quickly finds herself enarmoured with Fuuro and her ambitious and motivational nature. Fuuro on the other hand falls for her over time, becoming smitten with Shinju’s elegance and the way she carries herself as well as her caring and gentle nature.
Fukasu has noticed the two developed feelings for each other and, after watching Fuuro make hearteyes at Shinju day after day, she eventually convinced Fuuro to make a move and the two got together.
Fuuro loves Shinju’s smile, her eyes. She often strokes her scales absent-mindedly when they cuddle. Shinju loves being carried around and held by Fuuro. It makes her feel safe and secure. She’d love Fuuro to fly around with her but knows that her girlfriend has limits in her strength so that is only a dream (for now).
With Fuuro Shinju feels comfortable enough to talk about personal things, such as her father. Fuuro knows when to let Shinju have her alone time, just as Shinju knows that Fuuro needs her time for her frequent training. Both know they can rely on and trust the other.
Shinju may see the value in simple things but she occasionally buys Fuuro expensive gifts, just to impress her girlfriend a little.
Since both have an interest for fashion (albeit different styles) they like going shopping together. Fuuro sometimes takes Shinju out to eat at small, local restaurants which Shinju is fascinated by, only being used to either eating at home or going to expensive restaurants.
At the end of a day the two also enjoy taking long walks on the beach together, Fuuro watching lovingly as Shinju excitedly collects various seashells.

Trivia

  • Fuuro is bisexual
  • She often trains her Quirk by strapping increasingly heavier weights to herself and flying around for as long as she can
  • Her love for punk fashion and intimidating appearance often give her the image of a delinquent when in reality she is a very law-abiding person and chastises even the smallest offense to the law
  • In her childhood a lot of socks and shoes ended up ripped and cut due to her very sharp talons so she stopped wearing them all together
  • She attacks like an owl, with her feet first
  • She has a habit of perching on high places
  • She is not a morning person
  • She tends to screw up her sleeping schedule by staying up too late
trail.content:
Reference sheet for my BnHA OC Fuuro Kuroba

Profile under the cut

Biographical Information

Name: Kuroba Fuuro
Nickname(s): Fuu, Birdbrain (by her brother)
Alias/Hero Name: The Nocturnal Heroine, Night Owl

Personal Description

Birthday: December 12
Star Sign: Sagittarius
Age: 17/18 years
Gender: female
Height: 181cm
Weight: 77kg
Hair colour: Dark grey
Eye colour: Purple
Skin colour: Tan
Quirk: Owl
Quirk type: Transformation
Quirk range: Short-range

Status

Status: Alive
Family:
  Kuroba Asuka (mother, alive)
   Kuroba Yuuto (father, alive)
   Kuroba Souma (younger brother, alive)
Affiliation: Yuuei Academy
Occupation: Student
Department: Heroics
Class: 2-A
Love Interest: Abe Shinju (OC)

Appearance
Fuuro is a tall, muscular girl with relatively broad shoulders. She has short black hair in an undercut and bright purple, upturned eyes. Her legs have a bird-like appearance with scaly skin, very sharp talons and an anisodactyl toe arrangement.
Her Yuuei uniform is sleeveless and it can open along the seams on the sides so it doesn’t rip when has to activate her Quirk while in uniform.

Personality

Ambitious | Prideful | Sporty | Hardworking | Competitive

Fuuro is extremely law-abiding and makes sure to follow rules set by authority at all times. If it isn’t about rules then she is fairly reasonable.
However she is not above pointless arguments and will often treat a discussion about trivial things too seriously. She tends to overlook any flaws of the people she idolizes greatly, like her mother and tends to be overly formal and reserved around them. Insulting those people greatly enrages her and if someone does so continually she will loose her temper. She won’t get violent usually but she can get very vocal when angry. She can see her own actions critically and also that of most other people (if she doesn’t happen to idolize them) so she is generally a good choice when you need an objective second opinion.
Fuuro very often tells herself that she prefers to work alone since her mother also works alone and she aspires to be like her but she always feels a certain comfort having someone by her side or watch her back. She can generally work well with others and is perfect for organizing teamwork as she has just the right authoritative presence to ensure that everyone is doing their part diligently.
She takes pride in her own abilites and accomplishments. Because she is a bit vain when it comes to that, it is very easy to get on her good side with flattery and compliments.
For people who don’t know her she often appears stoic and unapproachable with a stone-cold, serious expression and she tends to keep that image up around strangers because she wants to appear as someone admirable and authoritative. She only loosens up when around friends or her family. When she is comfortable and doesn’t feel the need to appear stern and control her expression, her emotions are very often painfully obvious in her face.
She finds it very easy to motivate herself. She enjoys challenging her own limits and regularily does so even if in a controlled manner. She sees stepping out of one’s boundaries as a way to improve and exceed yourself.
She is ready to face pressure and obstacles in her way to become a hero so she isn’t really that affected by pressure. She is determined to finish assigned tasks as quick as possible and works diligently and restlessly on them. She’s not a person that regularily slacks off.

Likes
-Punk fashion
-Sweets
-Storms
-Nighttime
-Meat (especially rabbit meat)
-Rainy nights
-The feeling of blowing wind

Dislikes
-Ghost stories
-Rule-breakers
-People who don’t want to leave their comfort zone
-Mornings
-The nicknames her brother gives her
-Insects

Quirk
Owl Wings

Fuuro’s Quirk allows her to transform her arms into owl wings with dark-grey/black feathers. When her Quirk is not active her arms have tiny black feathers protruding from the skin.

Advantage:

+ She can fly for a very long time

+ Her owl-like wings allow her to fly completely soundless which makes her a great suprise-attacker

+ Her arm muscles take a very long time to get tired

+She can easily defend herself against enemies with gas-based Quirks (can blow it away)

+She is also a good support for allies with a gas-based Quirk (can quickly blow it in the direction of the enemy)

Disadvantage:

- Carrying extra weight exhausts her quickly. She doesn’t mind one kilogramm or two. But everything over 5 kg drastically cuts her flying time. If she has to carry another person, she can maybe manage to fly for a couple of minutes before her wings give out.

- Her bones are lighter and thus more fragile, making her less suited for defense


Backstory:

Fuuro’s mother is a hero herself while her father, who is quirkless, works as a police officer.

Lawfullness practically ran in her family. She also has a younger brother.

Her mother Quirk lets her grow black-feathered wings on her back with which she can fly completely soundless and just like Fuuro has bird-like legs, though they are even more bird-like in structure than Fuuro’s. Additionally Asuka has feathery hair.

Fuuro’s Quirk manifested on a family trip while they were hiking. She climbed up a very high tree and was just enjoying the scenery when her Quirk manifested and she grew little feathers on her arms and her legs changed into the bird legs she has today. She noticed this and by chance transformed her arms into wings. She was absolutely thrilled, having looked up to her mother all her life and now she inherited her Quirk.

When her mother called out to her that they wanted to continue the hike, she flew down from the tree. Her mother was overjoyed, as was her father. At the end of the trip Fuuro’s hiking shoes were in shambles since her talons cut through them. She felt a bit bad about it, since they were kind of expensive. Afterwards her mother took her under her wing, quite literally.

Her younger brother remained quirkless and he eventually decided to pursue a career as a lawyer while Fuuro aimed to become a hero like her mother.

She brought herself in good physical shape by following a strict work-out schedule that her mother occasionally helped her with and studied very hard to get into Yuuei, where her mother had also studied. At Yuuei she entered the class 1-A (a year before the main cast enters the school, she is in 2-A during the story) and made friends amongst her classmates and even one outside the school. Two of them being Fukasu and Shinju. She eventually developed a crush on the latter. After being convinced by Fukasu she confessed to her and the two have been in a relationship ever since.



Relationships

Family

Kuroba Asuka - mother

Fuuro greatly idolized her mother. She looks up to her for risking her life on a daily basis for the greater good. She aspires to be like her mother and maybe take her place when she gets old. Fuuro tends to praise her to high heaven’s and doesn’t see any flaws that she might have.

Her mother is naturally very proud of what her daughter manages to achieve by following in her footsteps but silently wishes she’d try and be her own hero instead of imitating her.

Asuka spends a lot of time with her daughter but despite that their relationship is more like that of a teacher and student rather than mother and daughter which makes Asuka sad. Fuuro on the other hand doesn’t appear to be bothered by the formal and almost distant relationship she has with her mother.


Kuroba Yuuto - father

Fuuro looks up to her father as well but not to the extreme degree she does with her mother, ultimately making her relationship with him more “family-like”.

Yuuto is aware that Asuka is not happy about her current relationship with Fuuro and tries his best to convince his daughter to treat her mother more like a mother and communicate between the two without telling Fuuro explicitly how her mother feels because he knows Fuuro will think she has disappointed her mother in some way, which would only make the whole ordeal worse.


Kuroba Souma - younger brother

Souma doesn’t hold any grudges against his sister for inheriting their mother’s Quirk even though he turned out to be quirkless.

The two often bicker but mostly about trivial things and they don’t get too insulting, usually.

Souma has always made an effort to get better grades than Fuuro to show her that even if she has a Quirk and is more physically fit, he is the smarter one. His favourite nickname for Fuuro is “birdbrain” but he makes sure not to use it when their mother is around since she doesn’t like it when he calls her that. Even though he aspires to be a lawyer he doesn’t mind when he unintentionally (or intentionally) commits a minor misdemeanor. His nonchalant attitude about this and Fuuro’s overbearing law-abidingness are very often the cause of their bickering.


OCs

Hokori Fukasu - friend

They often hang out at Shinju’s place together, but not so much with just the two of them.

If it weren’t for Shinju the two of them probably would have never met. Fukasu finds Fuuro entertaining and often makes stupid dares with her (nothing that would break any rules though). Fukasu’s carefree attitude reminds Fuuro of her brother, which can be a good and a bad thing. She and Fuuro share a love for sweets

Fuuro got to know her when doing organisational work with Shinju at her place as Fukasu and her mother live there as well. Fukasu immidiately noticed that Shinju and Fuuro had a thing for each other. Fuuro is very thankful that she convinced her to confess to Shinju. Fukasu now is the designated “third wheel” whenever they hang out, but she doesn’t mind it.


Abe Shinju - girlfriend

They have been together since the end of their first year.
The two first started talking to each other when Shinju became the class president and Fuuro the vice class president. Fuuro also befriended a childhood friend of Shinju: Fukasu who attended Shiketsu High and whom she met at times when meeting at Shinju’s place.
The two started spending even more time with each other and got to know each other better. Having to organize class events together both of them learned how to rely on each other.
Shinju quickly finds herself enarmoured with Fuuro and her ambitious and motivational nature. Fuuro on the other hand falls for her over time, becoming smitten with Shinju’s elegance and the way she carries herself as well as her caring and gentle nature.
Fukasu has noticed the two developed feelings for each other and, after watching Fuuro make hearteyes at Shinju day after day, she eventually convinced Fuuro to make a move and the two got together.
Fuuro loves Shinju’s smile, her eyes. She often strokes her scales absent-mindedly when they cuddle. Shinju loves being carried around and held by Fuuro. It makes her feel safe and secure. She’d love Fuuro to fly around with her but knows that her girlfriend has limits in her strength so that is only a dream (for now).
With Fuuro Shinju feels comfortable enough to talk about personal things, such as her father. Fuuro knows when to let Shinju have her alone time, just as Shinju knows that Fuuro needs her time for her frequent training. Both know they can rely on and trust the other.
Shinju may see the value in simple things but she occasionally buys Fuuro expensive gifts, just to impress her girlfriend a little.
Since both have an interest for fashion (albeit different styles) they like going shopping together. Fuuro sometimes takes Shinju out to eat at small, local restaurants which Shinju is fascinated by, only being used to either eating at home or going to expensive restaurants.
At the end of a day the two also enjoy taking long walks on the beach together, Fuuro watching lovingly as Shinju excitedly collects various seashells.

Trivia

  • Fuuro is bisexual
  • She often trains her Quirk by strapping increasingly heavier weights to herself and flying around for as long as she can
  • Her love for punk fashion and intimidating appearance often give her the image of a delinquent when in reality she is a very law-abiding person and chastises even the smallest offense to the law
  • In her childhood a lot of socks and shoes ended up ripped and cut due to her very sharp talons so she stopped wearing them all together
  • She attacks like an owl, with her feet first
  • She has a habit of perching on high places
  • She is not a morning person
  • She tends to screw up her sleeping schedule by staying up too late

Biographical Information Name: Abe Shinju Nickname(s):...
caption:
Reference sheet of my BnHA OC Shinju Abe

Profile under the cut!

Biographical Information

Name: Abe Shinju
Nickname(s): Shin, Shi
Alias/Hero Name: The Soapy Hero, Iridescence

Personal Description

Birthdate: May 28
Star Sign: Gemini
Age: 17/18 years
Gender: female
Height: 172cm
Weight: 64kg
Hair colour: Light turquoise
Eye colour: Dark blue
Skin colour:  Peachy
Quirk: Bubble
Quirk type: Emitter
Quirk range: All ranges

Status

Status: Alive
Family:
  Abe Manami (mother, alive)
   Hamawaki Katashi (father, alive but imprisoned)
Affiliation: Yuuei
Occupation: Student
Department: Heroics
Class: 2-A
Love Interest: Kuroba Fuuro (OC)

Appearance
Shinju has a rather slim body and moderate chest. Her height is slightly above average.
She has long, straight, light turquoise hair that falls to the middle of her back. Two bangs fall over her shoulders adorned by white ribbons that wrap around the bangs like tubes.
She has patches of silver, glistening scales on her body and gentle, narrow eyes with long lashes. Her eyes appear to be completely dark blue with no visible scalera.
She wears the standard Yuuei Uniform.

Personality

Reserved | Polite | Motherly | Logical | Adaptable

Shinju is quiet, reserved and independent. She pefers a few close friends over a wide group of people she barely knows and sometimes just needs some time alone.
If pushed too far she can have emotional outbursts. Other than those time she generally keeps her emotions to herself and does not share things about herself very often. That she only does when she trusts a person and has a deep bond with them. Despite coming from a wealthy family she is very humble and sees value in the simple things.
Shinju speaks in a polite manner, being able to word even criticism in such a gentle way that people don’t realize they were just criticized. She has an incredibly gentle and calming demeanor and seems unfathomable. Her kind and understanding nature makes her good at calming people down and reassuring those who are unsure or doubting themselves. She’ll patiently listen to someone’s problems and offer help. Any secret is safe with her.
She often feels like she has to take care of everything which often ends up with her taking control over everything and mothering people who don’t want it.
She’s a logical thinker and loves learning and expanding her horizon. Being able to adapt to new situations fast, she can make quick and effective decisions even when faced with an unexpected event.
She will treat anyone she meets with respect unless they prove to her that they do not deserve her respect. Once you have lost it, her respect will be very hard to earn back.
People who lost her respect will be treated coldly or ignored at given situations.

Likes
-Gemstones
-Swimming
-Music
-Fashion
-Collecting seashells
-Sushi
-Fireworks

Dislikes
-Gaudy fashion
-People who are rude for fun
-Chlorinated water
-Onions

Quirk
Bubble


Her Quirk gives her the ability to form bubbles out of her own spit. She can make bubbles of varying sizes, from teeny tiny to big enough to contain a person. Additionally only she can pop them.
She can make three kinds of bubbles:
1) Impassable ones that no one can pass through, not even her! They are perfect for being used as protection against attacks
2) One-time-passable ones through which a person can pass only once and then the bubble becomes impassable. Perfect for protecting civilians and allies or imprisoning villains.
3)Passable ones that anyone can pass through (but not pop). These are mainly used to confuse opponents.

Advantage:
+ The first 2 kinds of bubbles are perfect for protecting
+ There are no visible differences between the 3 kinds of bubbles so her opponent has to guess which kind it is

Disadvantage:
- She has to decide before making a bubble what kind she wants to make, once she started she can not change the kind of bubble
- If she has not decided before making the bubble it will act just like a completely normal bubble (meaning it can be popped by the smallest contact)
- Making very big bubbles takes time and the process can be disturbed when she has to cough
- Depending on how big she makes them, she can only make a certain amount
- They pop on their own when enough time has passed or when Shinju is knocked out.

Backstory:
Shinju’s father Katashi was a villain. He only ever appeared disguised and using his transformation-type Quirk so his “real” appearance was unknown.
He planned to break members of his old villain group out of prison when he noticed that he struggled more and more against heroes and feared that if he kept fighting alone he might be imprisoned too.
He wanted to try and get closer to one of the influential families that maintained the high-security villain prisons to find out more about the prison and formulate a proper plan to break them out. Eventually he managed to insert himself into one of the families by starting a relationship with Shinju’s mother, Manami Abe, through whom he hoped to get his hands on information about the prison.
But the results did not come as fast as he wanted. His impatience and frustration started to seep in his relationship and it turned abusive.
Because of his previous very careful and considerate beheaviour Shinju’s mother continually excused and denied his abuse and thought that it’d stop it eventually.
Shinju’s father grew worried that his frustration and the resulting abuse might disturb his plans, if Manami chose to break up with him. So he came up with the idea to “secure” his relationship with Shinju’s mother by having a child together. Since Shinju’s mother also had a Quirk he hoped the child would inherit one of their Quirks or maybe even both and he could groom them to become a successor of sorts.
Shortly after Shinju was born, her father put his plan to break his group out of prison in motion. He succeeded but his success was short-lived. A group of heroes quickly took up pursuit and eventually caught him, though not all members of his villain group were caught again. Shinju, who was taken by her father after the prisonbreak, was brought back to her mother.
Manami, even though deeply hurt by Katashi, continued to take care of Shinju as her daughter. She recieved support from her family and was guarded by a personal hero in case one of the members of Katashi’s villain group would show up. Manami later employed the guard permanently (on her father’s wish).
Shinju was lucky not to have inherited many traits from her father, which is one of the main reasons her mother could bear to raise her. The only thing reminiscient of his genes being the patches of silvery scales on Shinju’s body. Her Quirk, too, ended up being that of her mother, which she could not be happier about as she feared that being more like him would cause her mother to hate her. She despises her father after being old enough to be told and understand what happened.
She always tried to “take care” of her mother from a very young age, taking many responsibilites of off her so she doesn’t have to worry about it. There was no personnel around for quite some times because Shinju’s mother was afraid of having anyone outside of the direct family into the house, so Shinju took up the household chores and even learned how to cook very early. Even when her mother employed personnel again, she continued doing some of the chores.
Shinju, being homeschooled, did not have that much interaction with people outside of her family and the housestaff. Her only “friend” was Fukasu, the child of the personal body guard hero who lived at their house.
Shinju eventually decided to pursue a career as a hero to distance herself from her father as much as possible and also to appeal to her mother, signalizing to her that she will never become like her father.
Once accepted into Yuuei she was assigned to class 1-A. Unfortunately for her her friend Fukasu, who also tried to get into Yuuei, failed the Entrance Exam.

Relationships

Family:

Abe Manami - mother
Shinju’s relationship with her mother is complicated. While both love each other there is an underlying, barely there but still existing fear on both sides. Shinju fears her mother’s rejection and being grouped with her father while Manami fears Shinju making a 180° turn and becoming just like Katashi. Both of them also violently try to reject that fear but it’s still there.
Shinju sees her mother as an incredibly strong person who could continue on living through such a devastating relationship. She tries her best to appeal to her mother and make her feel safe. Manami sees her daughter as the one “good thing that came out of her relationship with Katashi.

Hamasaki Katashi - father
Katashi knows next to nothing about Shinju and has not seen her after the heroes captured him. Shinju harbours nothing but resentment towards her father. She knows that he is in prison but has never and most likely will never go and see him. She is afraid to.

OCs:

Hokori Fukasu - childhood friend
The child of Manami’s personal body guard and Shinju’s first real friend. They spent a lot of time together in their childhoods and still do today. When Shinju first started thinking about pursuing a career as a hero Fukasu was immidiately on board too. The two started to spend some of their time training their Quirks to prepare for the entrance exam.
She was the one who got Shinju and Fuuro together.

Kuroba Fūro - girlfriend
They have been together since the end of their first year.
The two first started talking to each other when Shinju became the class president and Fūro the vice class president. Fūro also befriended a childhood friend of Shinju: Fukasu who attended Shiketsu High and whom she met at times when meeting at Shinju’s place.
The two started spending even more time with each other and got to know each other better. Having to organize class events together both of them learned how to rely on each other.
Shinju quickly finds herself enarmoured with Fūro and her ambitious and motivational nature.
Fūro on the other hand falls for her over time, becoming smitten with Shinju’s elegance and the way she carries herself as well as her caring and gentle nature.
Fukasu has noticed the two developed feelings for each other and, after watching Fūro make hearteyes at Shinju day after day, she eventually convinced Fūro to make a move and the two got together.

Fūro loves Shinju’s smile, her eyes. She often strokes her scales absent-mindedly when they cuddle. Shinju loves being carried around and held by Fūro. It makes her feel safe and secure. She’d love Fūro to fly around with her but knows that her girlfriend has limits in her strength so that is only a dream (for now).
With Fūro Shinju feels comfortable enough to talk about personal things, such as her father.
Fūro knows when to let Shinju have her alone time, just as Shinju knows that Fūro needs her time for her frequent training. Both know they can rely on and trust the other.
Shinju may see the value in simple things but she occasionally buys Fūro expensive gifts, just to impress her girlfriend a little.
Since both have an interest for fashion (albeit different styles) they like going shopping together. Fūro sometimes takes Shinju out to eat at small, local restaurants which Shinju is fascinated by, only being used to either eating at home or going to expensive restaurants.
At the end of a day the two also enjoy taking long walks on the beach together, Fūro watching lovingly as Shinju excitedly collects various seashells.

Trivia:
-She’s a lesbian
-Her saliva smells kinda soap-y
-The feeling of water on her skin is very soothing for her
-She plays the violin to release frustration, the pieces she plays always end up sounding chaotic and energetic as a result

Shinju’s father grew worried that his frustration and the resulting abuse might disturb his plans, if Manami chose to break up with him. So he came up with the idea to “secure” his relationship with Shinju’s mother by having a child together. Since Shinju’s mother also had a Quirk he hoped the child would inherit one of their Quirks or maybe even both and he could groom them to become a successor of sorts.
Shortly after Shinju was born, her father put his plan to break his group out of prison in motion. He succeeded but his success was short-lived. A group of heroes quickly took up pursuit and eventually caught him, though not all members of his villain group were caught again. Shinju, who was taken by her father after the prisonbreak, was brought back to her mother.
Manami, even though deeply hurt by Katashi, continued to take care of Shinju as her daughter. She recieved support from her family and was guarded by a personal hero in case one of the members of Katashi’s villain group would show up. Manami later employed the guard permanently (on her father’s wish).
Shinju was lucky not to have inherited many traits from her father, which is one of the main reasons her mother could bear to raise her. The only thing reminiscient of his genes being the patches of silvery scales on Shinju’s body. Her Quirk, too, ended up being that of her mother, which she could not be happier about as she feared that being more like him would cause her mother to hate her. She despises her father after being old enough to be told and understand what happened.
She always tried to “take care” of her mother from a very young age, taking many responsibilites of off her so she doesn’t have to worry about it. There was no personnel around for quite some times because Shinju’s mother was afraid of having anyone outside of the direct family into the house, so Shinju took up the household chores and even learned how to cook very early. Even when her mother employed personnel again, she continued doing some of the chores.
Shinju, being homeschooled, did not have that much interaction with people outside of her family and the housestaff. Her only “friend” was Fukasu, the child of the personal body guard hero who lived at their house.
Shinju eventually decided to pursue a career as a hero to distance herself from her father as much as possible and also to appeal to her mother, signalizing to her that she will never become like her father.
Once accepted into Yuuei she was assigned to class 1-A. Unfortunately for her her friend Fukasu, who also tried to get into Yuuei, failed the Entrance Exam.

Relationships

Family:

Abe Manami - mother
Shinju’s relationship with her mother is complicated. While both love each other there is an underlying, barely there but still existing fear on both sides. Shinju fears her mother’s rejection and being grouped with her father while Manami fears Shinju making a 180° turn and becoming just like Katashi. Both of them also violently try to reject that fear but it’s still there.
Shinju sees her mother as an incredibly strong person who could continue on living through such a devastating relationship. She tries her best to appeal to her mother and make her feel safe. Manami sees her daughter as the one “good thing that came out of her relationship with Katashi.

Hamasaki Katashi - father
Katashi knows next to nothing about Shinju and has not seen her after the heroes captured him. Shinju harbours nothing but resentment towards her father. She knows that he is in prison but has never and most likely will never go and see him. She is afraid to.

OCs:

Hokori Fukasu - childhood friend
The child of Manami’s personal body guard and Shinju’s first real friend. They spent a lot of time together in their childhoods and still do today. When Shinju first started thinking about pursuing a career as a hero Fukasu was immidiately on board too. The two started to spend some of their time training their Quirks to prepare for the entrance exam.
She was the one who got Shinju and Fuuro together.

Kuroba Fūro - girlfriend
They have been together since the end of their first year.
The two first started talking to each other when Shinju became the class president and Fūro the vice class president. Fūro also befriended a childhood friend of Shinju: Fukasu who attended Shiketsu High and whom she met at times when meeting at Shinju’s place.
The two started spending even more time with each other and got to know each other better. Having to organize class events together both of them learned how to rely on each other.
Shinju quickly finds herself enarmoured with Fūro and her ambitious and motivational nature.
Fūro on the other hand falls for her over time, becoming smitten with Shinju’s elegance and the way she carries herself as well as her caring and gentle nature.
Fukasu has noticed the two developed feelings for each other and, after watching Fūro make hearteyes at Shinju day after day, she eventually convinced Fūro to make a move and the two got together.

Fūro loves Shinju’s smile, her eyes. She often strokes her scales absent-mindedly when they cuddle. Shinju loves being carried around and held by Fūro. It makes her feel safe and secure. She’d love Fūro to fly around with her but knows that her girlfriend has limits in her strength so that is only a dream (for now).
With Fūro Shinju feels comfortable enough to talk about personal things, such as her father.
Fūro knows when to let Shinju have her alone time, just as Shinju knows that Fūro needs her time for her frequent training. Both know they can rely on and trust the other.
Shinju may see the value in simple things but she occasionally buys Fūro expensive gifts, just to impress her girlfriend a little.
Since both have an interest for fashion (albeit different styles) they like going shopping together. Fūro sometimes takes Shinju out to eat at small, local restaurants which Shinju is fascinated by, only being used to either eating at home or going to expensive restaurants.
At the end of a day the two also enjoy taking long walks on the beach together, Fūro watching lovingly as Shinju excitedly collects various seashells.

Trivia:
-She’s a lesbian
-Her saliva smells kinda soap-y
-The feeling of water on her skin is very soothing for her
-She plays the violin to release frustration, the pieces she plays always end up sounding chaotic and energetic as a result

Birthdate: May 28
Star Sign: Gemini

Gender: female

Weight: 64kg
Hair colour: Light turquoise
Eye colour: Dark blue
Skin colour:  Peachy
Quirk: Bubble
Quirk type: Emitter
Quirk range: All ranges

Status

Status: Alive
Family:
  Abe Manami (mother, alive)
   Hamawaki Katashi (father, alive but imprisoned)
Affiliation: Yuuei
Occupation: Student
Department: Heroics
Class: 2-A
Love Interest: Kuroba Fuuro (OC)

Appearance
Shinju has a rather slim body and moderate chest. Her height is slightly above average.
She has long, straight, light turquoise hair that falls to the middle of her back. Two bangs fall over her shoulders adorned by white ribbons that wrap around the bangs like tubes.
She has patches of silver, glistening scales on her body and gentle, narrow eyes with long lashes. Her eyes appear to be completely dark blue with no visible scalera.
She wears the standard Yuuei Uniform.

Personality

Reserved | Polite | Motherly | Logical | Adaptable

Shinju is quiet, reserved and independent. She pefers a few close friends over a wide group of people she barely knows and sometimes just needs some time alone.
If pushed too far she can have emotional outbursts. Other than those time she generally keeps her emotions to herself and does not share things about herself very often. That she only does when she trusts a person and has a deep bond with them. Despite coming from a wealthy family she is very humble and sees value in the simple things.
Shinju speaks in a polite manner, being able to word even criticism in such a gentle way that people don’t realize they were just criticized. She has an incredibly gentle and calming demeanor and seems unfathomable. Her kind and understanding nature makes her good at calming people down and reassuring those who are unsure or doubting themselves. She’ll patiently listen to someone’s problems and offer help. Any secret is safe with her.
She often feels like she has to take care of everything which often ends up with her taking control over everything and mothering people who don’t want it.
She’s a logical thinker and loves learning and expanding her horizon. Being able to adapt to new situations fast, she can make quick and effective decisions even when faced with an unexpected event.
She will treat anyone she meets with respect unless they prove to her that they do not deserve her respect. Once you have lost it, her respect will be very hard to earn back.
People who lost her respect will be treated coldly or ignored at given situations.

Likes
-Gemstones
-Swimming
-Music
-Fashion
-Collecting seashells
-Sushi
-Fireworks

Dislikes
-Gaudy fashion
-People who are rude for fun
-Chlorinated water
-Onions

Bubble


Her Quirk gives her the ability to form bubbles out of her own spit. She can make bubbles of varying sizes, from teeny tiny to big enough to contain a person. Additionally only she can pop them.
She can make three kinds of bubbles:
1) Impassable ones that no one can pass through, not even her! They are perfect for being used as protection against attacks
2) One-time-passable ones through which a person can pass only once and then the bubble becomes impassable. Perfect for protecting civilians and allies or imprisoning villains.
3)Passable ones that anyone can pass through (but not pop). These are mainly used to confuse opponents.

Advantage:
+ The first 2 kinds of bubbles are perfect for protecting
+ There are no visible differences between the 3 kinds of bubbles so her opponent has to guess which kind it is

Disadvantage:
- She has to decide before making a bubble what kind she wants to make, once she started she can not change the kind of bubble
- If she has not decided before making the bubble it will act just like a completely normal bubble (meaning it can be popped by the smallest contact)
- Making very big bubbles takes time and the process can be disturbed when she has to cough
- Depending on how big she makes them, she can only make a certain amount
- They pop on their own when enough time has passed or when Shinju is knocked out.
